verses.verse: If there be a controversy<WH7379> between men<WH582>, and they come<WH5066> unto judgment<WH4941>, that the judges may judge<WH8199> them; then they shall justify<WH6663> the righteous<WH6662>, and condemn<WH7561> the wicked<WH7563>.

And it shall be, if the wicked man<WH7563> be worthy<WH1121> to be beaten<WH5221>, that the judge<WH8199> shall cause him to lie down<WH5307>, and to be beaten<WH5221> before his face<WH6440>, according<WH1767> to his fault<WH7564>, by a certain number<WH4557>.

Forty<WH705> stripes<WH5221> he may give him, and not exceed<WH3254>: lest, if he should exceed<WH3254>, and beat<WH5221> him above these with many<WH7227> stripes<WH4347>, then thy brother<WH251> should seem vile<WH7034><WH5869> unto thee.
¶ Thou shalt not muzzle<WH2629> the ox<WH7794> when he treadeth out<WH1778> the corn.

¶ If brethren<WH251> dwell<WH3427> together<WH3162>, and one<WH259> of them die<WH4191>, and have no child<WH1121>, the wife<WH802> of the dead<WH4191> shall not marry without<WH2351> unto a stranger<WH376><WH2114>: her husband's brother<WH2993> shall go in<WH935> unto her, and take<WH3947> her to him to wife<WH802>, and perform the duty of an husband's brother<WH2992> unto her.

And it shall be, that the firstborn<WH1060> which she beareth<WH3205> shall succeed<WH6965> in the name<WH8034> of his brother<WH251> which is dead<WH4191>, that his name<WH8034> be not put out<WH4229> of Israel<WH3478>.

And if the man<WH376> like<WH2654> not to take<WH3947> his brother's wife<WH2994>, then let his brother's wife<WH2994> go up<WH5927> to the gate<WH8179> unto the elders<WH2205>, and say<WH559>, My husband's brother<WH2993> refuseth<WH3985> to raise up<WH6965> unto his brother<WH251> a name<WH8034> in Israel<WH3478>, he will<WH14> not perform the duty of my husband's brother<WH2992>.
Then the elders<WH2205> of his city<WH5892> shall call<WH7121> him, and speak<WH1696> unto him: and if he stand<WH5975> to it, and say<WH559>, I like<WH2654> not to take<WH3947> her;

Then shall his brother's wife<WH2994> come<WH5066> unto him in the presence<WH5869> of the elders<WH2205>, and loose<WH2502> his shoe<WH5275> from off his foot<WH7272>, and spit<WH3417> in his face<WH6440>, and shall answer<WH6030> and say<WH559>, So shall it be done<WH6213> unto that man<WH376> that will not build up<WH1129> his brother's<WH251> house<WH1004>.
And his name<WH8034> shall be called<WH7121> in Israel<WH3478>, The house<WH1004> of him that hath his shoe<WH5275> loosed<WH2502>.

¶ When men<WH582> strive<WH5327> together<WH3162> one with another<WH251><WH376>, and the wife<WH802> of the one<WH259> draweth near<WH7126> for to deliver<WH5337> her husband<WH376> out of the hand<WH3027> of him that smiteth<WH5221> him, and putteth forth<WH7971> her hand<WH3027>, and taketh<WH2388> him by the secrets<WH4016>:
Then thou shalt cut off<WH7112> her hand<WH3709>, thine eye<WH5869> shall not pity<WH2347> her.
¶ Thou shalt not have in thy bag<WH3599> divers weights<WH68><WH68>, a great<WH1419> and a small<WH6996>.
Thou shalt not have in thine house<WH1004> divers measures<WH374><WH374>, a great<WH1419> and a small<WH6996>.

But thou shalt have a perfect<WH8003> and just<WH6664> weight<WH68>, a perfect<WH8003> and just<WH6664> measure<WH374> shalt thou have: that thy days<WH3117> may be lengthened<WH748> in the land<WH127> which the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> giveth<WH5414> thee.
For all that do<WH6213> such things<WH428>, and all that do<WH6213> unrighteously<WH5766>, are an abomination<WH8441> unto the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430>.
¶ Remember<WH2142> what Amalek<WH6002> did<WH6213> unto thee by the way<WH1870>, when ye were come forth<WH3318> out of Egypt<WH4714>;

How he met<WH7136> thee by the way<WH1870>, and smote the hindmost<WH2179> of thee, even all that were feeble<WH2826> behind<WH310> thee, when thou wast faint<WH5889> and weary<WH3023>; and he feared<WH3373> not God<WH430>.

Therefore it shall be, when the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> hath given thee rest<WH5117> from all thine enemies<WH341> round about<WH5439>, in the land<WH776> which the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> giveth<WH5414> thee for an inheritance<WH5159> to possess<WH3423> it, that thou shalt blot out<WH4229> the remembrance<WH2143> of Amalek<WH6002> from under heaven<WH8064>; thou shalt not forget<WH7911> it.
